description.p: Golden eyes flashing, a human stretches out her hand and unleashes the primal magic that courses through her veins. As an inferno rages around her foes, spectral wings of flame emerge from her back, lifting her above the chaos.

Hair flowing like a storm, a half-elf raises his arms to the sky. A surge of elemental energy crackles through him, erupting in a devastating wave of lightning that leaves the battlefield scorched and trembling.
With a feral grin, a halfling leaps into the fray, her hands wreathed in flickering green flames. As she strikes, the flames lash out, consuming her enemies in a blaze of wild, untamed power.

Wyldhearts are conduits of raw, unbridled magic, their power drawn from the untamed forces of nature, the elements, or even the chaotic weave of magic itself. Unlike wizards who study their craft or warlocks who bargain for their power, Wyldhearts are born with their gifts, their magic as much a part of them as their heartbeat.

The magic of a Wyldheart is wild and unpredictable, a force that defies control and demands to be unleashed. Some Wyldhearts draw their power from the elemental planes, channeling fire, water, air, or earth in its purest form. Others are touched by the chaotic essence of the Feywild or the Shadowfell, their magic a reflection of these strange and otherworldly realms.

The source of a Wyldheart's power is as unique as the individual. It might be the result of a fateful encounter with a powerful elemental, a blessing—or curse—from a capricious fey, or the lingering effects of a magical catastrophe. Whatever its origin, this power is both a gift and a burden, a force that shapes the Wyldheart's destiny.

Wyldhearts are adventurers by necessity, their magic too volatile to remain dormant. Whether they seek to master their abilities, uncover the truth of their origins, or simply survive in a world that fears their power, Wyldhearts are driven to explore, to fight, and to grow stronger.

Their magic is as versatile as it is unpredictable, allowing them to adapt to any situation. A Wyldheart might summon a storm to scatter their enemies, heal their allies with a touch of primal energy, or transform themselves into a creature of pure elemental fury. Whatever the challenge, a Wyldheart meets it head-on, their power a force of nature that cannot be denied.

When creating a Wyldheart, consider the source of your character's power. Was it a gift from a powerful being, an accident of birth, or the result of a life-changing event? How does your character feel about their abilities? Do they embrace their power, fear it, or struggle to control it? What drives them to adventure, and how does their magic shape their goals and relationships?

Your choice of background, skills, and spells should reflect your character's connection to their magic. A Wyldheart with ties to the elemental planes might favor spells like *Burning Hands* or *Thunderwave*, while one touched by the Feywild might lean toward enchantments and illusions. Whatever path you choose, your Wyldheart's magic is a reflection of their unique story.
As a wyldheart, you gain the following class features.

Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per wyldheart level after 1st

sheet.description: A spellcaster who channels the untamed forces of nature and the elements.

setters.set: A spellcaster who channels the untamed forces of nature and the elements.

description.p: Your bond with the primal forces of nature and your connection to your Wyld Companion allows you to wield magic as a channel of the world's wild and untamed essence. This power is not studied or inherited through bloodlines—it is a living force you attune to through instinct, emotion, and empathy.
At 1st level, you know four cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. You learn additional cantrips at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Wyldheart table.

The Wyldheart table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these Wyldheart spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell *entangle* and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast *entangle* using either slot.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the druid spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Wyldheart table shows when you learn more spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Wyldheart spells you know and replace it with another spell from the druid spell list, which must also be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Wyldheart spells, as your magic flows from your connection to wild spirits and your ability to channel their will. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Wyldheart spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

description.p: You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your Wyldheart spells.

sheet.description: You have the ability to cast Wyldheart spells.

description.p: At 1st level, you can summon a Wyld Companion, a creature that embodies the primal forces of nature. This companion is a manifestation of your bond with the wild and serves as your ally in battle and exploration. In combat, it acts as a pack creature.

The Wyld Companion can take the form of a beast or elemental creature, depending on your choice. You can summon it as a bonus action, and it remains with you until you dismiss it or it is reduced to 0 hit points.

Your Wyld Companion acts on your initiative and can take its own actions in combat. It has its own hit points, AC, and abilities, which are determined by its form. You can communicate telepathically with your Wyld Companion while it is within 100 feet of you.

sheet.description: You can summon a Wyld Companion to aid you in battle. In combat, it acts as a pack creature. Dissmissing a companion over 50% HP returns a use to you.

description.p: You gain a deep connection to the Wyld, choosing an ability score to be enhanced. This blessing amplifies your connection to nature, aligning your strengths with the primal forces.

At level 1, you can choose one ability score to increase based on your subclass: Greenspeakers (Constitution), Ravensong (Intelligence), Master of Hounds (Dexterity), Primal Lord (Strength), or Kaos Warden (Wisdom).
This bonus lasts throughout your journey as a Wyldheart and powers your natural abilities, spellcasting (adds mod to cantrip damage), and companion interactions.

sheet.description: Your connection to the Wyld grants you a permanent boost to cantrip damage based on your subclass modifier.

description.p: At 1st level, you can invoke the primal forces of nature to enhance your companion. Grant companion HP equal to 6*(Invocation Level).
Nature’s Invocation I (Level 1)

Healing Pulse: As a bonus action, you can grant yourself or your companion temporary hit points equal to your Wyldheart level + your Blessing of the Wyld modifier. Usable a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.​
Nature’s Invocation II (Level 6)

You can invoke the primal forces of nature to enhance your companion. As an action, you can release a burst of energy in a 15-foot cone. All enemies within the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or be knocked prone and pushed 10 feet away from you. Additionally, your summoned creatures within 60 feet of you gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw.
Nature’s Invocation III (Level 11)

Resilient Growth: When you or your companion drops to 0 hit points but isn't killed outright, you can cause them to drop to 1 hit point instead. Additionally, they gain temporary hit points equal to your Wyldheart level + your Blessing of the Wyld modifier. Usable once per long rest.​
Nature’s Invocation IV (Level 14)

Empowered Strikes: Your companion's weapon attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, they gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Blessing of the Wyld modifier.
Persistent Bond: If your companion is reduced to 0 hit points, they automatically stabilize and regain 1 hit point after 1 minute without requiring a saving throw.​
Nature’s Invocation V (Level 18)
Nature's Ascendancy: You and your companion gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
Verdant Revival: Once per long rest, when you or your companion is reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to have them immediately regain hit points equal to half their maximum hit points.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
At 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 1st level, your spirit resonates with the primal force of the Wyld, creating a deep, magical bond between you and your summoned companion. This Heart Resonance links your vitality and instincts with the creature’s, empowering both in combat and beyond.

When you take the Attack action, your companion can immediately make one weapon attack as a reaction. If the attack hits a creature you've also hit this turn, it deals extra damage equal to your (subclass modifier*Wyldheart level)/3, depending on subclass.

When a creature targets you or your companion with an attack while the other is within 10 feet, the targeted creature gains a +2 bonus to AC against that attack. This bonus increases to +3 at 10th level. This can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

Once per turn when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, your companion can move up to half its movement speed and make a single melee weapon attack as part of the same action. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

When you take the Attack action, your companion can use its reaction to make a melee attack against the same target if it can see it. If both your attack and your companion’s attack hit the same creature on the same turn, the creature has disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

sheet.description: Your companion can use its reaction to attack the same target when you take the Attack action. If both hit, target has disadvantage on its next attack roll.

description.p: When your companion is within 10 feet of you, it can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on an attack roll against you. If the attack misses, your companion can move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of once), and regain all uses after a long rest.

sheet.usage: Reaction / Dexterity modifier per Long Rest
sheet.description: Your companion can impose disadvantage on attacks against you if within 10 feet. If the attack misses, it can move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: As a bonus action, you and your companion can each move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When you do, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wyldheart level. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You and your companion can move up to half speed without provoking opportunity attacks and gain temporary HP equal to your Wyldheart level. Usable once per short or long rest.

description.p: At 7th level, your connection to nature protects you. While your companion is within 10 feet, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and harmful effects from magical creatures, additionally, both your companion's AC and your's increase by 2 as your skin toughens like wood.
